title: mum barred pub bouncers being
story: Mum barred from pub by bouncers for being too ugly before they steal her phoneMiss Sidebottom, who was on a pub crawl in Manchester city centre, was attacked by bouncers who called her "too ugly" before the doormen stole her £ phoneClaire Sidebottom was attacked and robbed of her mobile phone by doorman Christopher Cash Image: Claire Sidebottom  Cavendish PressLtdByAlec Whitaker:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA mum-of-one was attacked by two bouncers who proceeded to steal her mobile phone after she began filming them as they barred her from a pub for being “too ugly”. Claire Sidebottom was grabbed by her handbag strap and forcibly pulled into a safety barrier at the Manchester city centre club, as she filmed the bouncers and was threatening to report them as they laughed at her. Miss Sidebottom, who was on a pub crawl, dropped the phone before hearing one of the doormen shout: “Grab it and run”. She never saw the £ device again. In a statement to police, Miss Sidebottom said the theft meant she lost sentimental photographs and was unable to be contacted by the hospital who were treating her poorly young son. She also said she had lost faith in door staff and did not want to go out in Manchester City centre again. Police who investigated the robbery found one of the doormen in possession of two kubotans - a weapon used in Martial Arts to place targeted force into pressure points on the body. He has since resigned from his job on the doors of Bar Rogue, in Piccadilly Gardens.  At Minshull Street Crown Court, Manchester, Christopher Cash, , from Edgeley, Stockport, admitted robbery, common assault and possession of an offensive weapon and was ordered to pay Miss Sidebottom £, compensation. The other doorman died unexpectedly before he could be charged. After the case full time mother Miss Sidebottom from Mossley said: aposaposI’m glad this manaposs been punished even though I don’t think what he got enough. He was a doorman and he was there to protect people not to bully, assault and rob. aposaposIt has been my first bar crawl for a while and I felt targeted and bullied and felt hurt because people were laughing with him. That evening I only went out to take my mind off what was going on around me at the time. aposaposI can’t even go out around town anymore now without feeling another bouncer will hurt me. This man took my phone that had sentimental pictures of my baby that I can never get back. He took memories away from me.aposapos The incident occurred on February  last year five weeks before the UK lockdown. Andrew Evans, prosecuting, said: aposaposThe defendant was a doorman at the time and Miss Sidebottom was on a night out and was queuing to get in. She encountered Mr Cash and his colleague but she recalls she was refused entry because staff said that she was too drunk and a dispute arose. aposaposDuring that time, she recalls them saying she was too ugly to be let in so she decided to record their behaviour on her mobile phone, asked for their names and threatened to send the footage to head office. aposaposShe then recalls one of the doormen grabbing her phone from her hand but she was able to grab it back. She asked them why they thought they could take this but then recalls one of the males coming at her through the barrier, causing her to drop the phone. aposaposShe recalled falling to the ground and the doorman saying ‘grab it and run’ to someone nearby. He looked up to see someone dressed in black running away and she never saw the phone again. CCTV shows Cash trying to grab the phone by reaching over the barrier, he then grabs hold of her bag and there is a physical confrontation. aposaposThe bag is around her neck and she was forced forward a few steps into the metal barrier. She fights back and gets back her mobile phone. But the other doorman then parts the barrier, steps towards the complainant and grabs the phone causing her to drop it. aposaposMr Cash picks it up and quickly moves out of the way and goes back inside the bar. During this period Mr Cash walks directly towards a hooded person who had been hanging around up the street. He hands the phone to him and the hooded man runs off across Piccadilly Gardens.aposapos Cash said he assaulted Miss Sidebottom when he lunged through the barrier dragging her forward by pulling the bag around her neck. He then stole her phone which had been dropped on the floor and handed it to an unknown hooded man. Officers recovered one kubotan from Cashaposs jacket pocket following his arrest and seized another when they searched his bag in the police station. In mitigation for Cash, who now works as a delivery driver, defence counsel Anna Chestnutt said: “He is a conscientious gentleman who does feel bad as to what happened to Miss Sidebottom. He says she did not deserve to be assaulted and the phone should not have been taken. He understands she deserves to be compensated. “He resigned from his role as a doorman as he felt that was a good thing to do to prevent this from happening again.aposapos Sentencing the judge Mr Recorder Daniel Prowse told Cash: “You were working with a colleague when Miss Sidebottom was refused entry to the bar as she was told she was too drunk. She recalls being told she was too ugly to be let in. “She recorded the behaviour of you and your colleague on her phone asking for your names and threatening to send the footage to head office. It would seem it was that which prompted the offending that followed. She recalls one of the doormen grabbing the phone from her hand and another coming through the barrier, which caused her to drop her phone. aposaposYou were the one who first came towards her and pulled her. You took the phone from the floor and you handed it to someone who left with it. It seems to me the purpose was to deprive her of evidence of your behaviour. You abused your power as a door supervisor in relation to her.” Cash was also ordered to complete a -month community order,  hours unpaid work and  rehabilitation requirement days. title: mum terrified after doctor told
story: Mum terried after doctor told her baby needs open heart surgery at just -months-oldIzabella Toole, of Liverpool, has celebrated her th birthday since undergoing the miracle surgery that saved her le - she had been born premature with a hole in her heartIzabella Toole was born prematurely at just  weeks Image: Liverpool ECHOByZoe PeckLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA baby underwent open heart surgery at just six-months-old after being born premature with a hole in her heart. Izabella Toole was born at just  weeks at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital weighing just . lbs. The tot initially appeared well but soon began having breathing dficulties and spent the first few days of her le in intensive care. Parents Eleanor and James, of Liverpool, Merseyside, were shell-shocked when doctors then gave them the devastating news that their baby needed open heart surgery. This was due to a condition called ventricular septal defectwhich meant Izabella had a hole in the wall separating her two heart valves.Eleanor, , told the Liverpool Echo : The size of the hole meant it wasnapost going to sort itself out.  We were told she needed the operation before she was two and we decided we wanted her to have it sooner rather than later. The whole thing was terrying. It was a whirlwind. You just have to trust the experts that youaposre in safe hands. We were shell-shocked. At the time I donapost think you can really grasp how dficult it is to go through that as a family. At six months old, Izabella underwent the gruelling surgery at Alder Hey Childrenaposs Hospital. On January , the family celebrated the  year anniversary of the operation that saved their daughteraposs le. James, , said: You talk about it, you cry we came out the other end as a family.  It was terrying and obviously a traumatic thing to let your child go through but we knew it was for the best. The family are still processing the trauma of Izabellaaposs early health issues and want to raise awareness of the importance of research into heart defects that made the operation possible. James described their now ten-year-old daughter as wonderful, laid back and happy with dreams of becoming a make-up artist. The couple praised the incredible care and regular check ups they received from Alder Hey. Eleanor said: All the staff were really supportive. They have us a support team that looked after us too and made sure we were okay. During her treatment, Izabellaaposs parents gave consent for their daughter to take part in research projects to further understand heart conditions. They raised more than £ for the British Hearth Foundation in  and now feel it is important to give back to the research that helped their daughter. Eleanor added: It was research that made Izabellaaposs operation possible. Without the people that went before Izabella, all those years and open heart surgery and research, Izabella wouldnapost be where she is. news uk-news people-stuck-homes--hours-"Armed police at incident in Earlsdon, CoventryByBen EcclestonLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Armed police are surrounding a home which has locked down a street for over  hours after a dad barricaded himself inside the property with his son.The incident unfolded in Earlsdon, in Coventry, West Midlands, with officers called to an address in the early hours of Sunday morning at around .am, Coventry Live reports.The dad, , is inside the property with his eight-year-old son and has refused to come out. Armed police gathered outside a property at around .pm and are still there as neighbours have been forced to stay inside their homes. Eyewitnesses have spoken of up to  armed officers at the scene, Coventry Live reports.  Dramatic images shows an armed police officer standing feet away with his weapon pointing towards the propertyaposs front door. Several armed officers are also surrounding the end of terrace house. A couple trapped inside the cordon say they have been left very scared. Gemma Phillips and Tom McGuinness have been trapped inside their house since the drama unfolded. Gemma said: It has been quite hard, Tom tried to go out yesterday to get essentials, he managed to get out but they wouldnapost let him back in... he managed to get back in but it took a while.As of this morning we have been told to stay in the house altogether.  Ms Phillips is a gymnastics teacher and has not been able to leave the house to get to work, partner Tom McGuinness works at a local casino but is currently on annual leave. The couple, who have lived in Earlsdon for eight years, described the feeling on the road: It was very broken sleep last night, itaposs worrying for the young lad [involved]. We just hope for a peaceful end to it, sooner rather than later. We are worried but itaposs a strange feeling being worried about whataposs going on and feeling the safest youaposve ever been. Weaposre on a police cordoned off area.From what we can see several armed police, God knows up the streets whataposs happening there - you feel safe and worried at the same time Mr McGuinness said. Ms Phillips added: We are very scared, it is a very scary thing for armed police to be outside your house... we hope that it comes to a calm ending.  Another resident living nearby, who did not wish to be named, described the moment armed police swooped the street. I hadnapost noticed anything until around noon when I opened our blinds and saw about four or five police cars and a van, they said. Another neighbour said she has not been allowed to leave her house since pm on Sunday.. She said: It wasnapost until pm that we noticed the cordon and the police on the street. We were looking out the window and popped out of the front door to have a look, and we were told that we had to stay inside. People in the street were also told to not to walk their dogs or go the nearby shops. Weaposve been stuck inside ever since. They eased off a little this morning, because I needed to go the shops for my child. We had to inform the police of our house number. We can see several unmarked police cars and one car with guns pointed at the house, as well as officers congregating around the front door. I was born and grew up here, and it is a quiet area - we have a lot of students living around here. It is a middle-class area. It has a community feel. It is the nicest area in Coventry so this is a shock. I have never seen or met the person or the child in the house, but I know the house is a half-way house.  Itaposs been over  hours now, it has been a complete surprise. The ongoing stand-off has forced a neighbour primary school to close. Earlsdon Primary School issued a statement saying: West Mids Police cordoned off an area around Earlsdon Ave North today while officers deal with an incident.The decision has been taken to close the school on Monday. We apologise for any inconvenience. We hope you understand this is in the interests of pupils, staff and parents. A West Midlands Police spokesperson said: A cordon remains in place around a house in Earlsdon Avenue North, Coventry this morning where a man has been refusing to come out since the early hours of yesterday morning .  The -year-old has his eight-year-old son with him and there are some concerns for their safety. Several officers, including armed police and other specially trained officers, are at the scene to bring the incident to a safe conclusion. Unfortunately, residents, businesses, a school and travel are severely disrupted by the cordon. We’re sorry for the inconvenience, but our priority is the safety of those involved. Please avoid the area where possible and we will issue updates on the situation as soon as we can. The library at Earlsdon Avenue North and Albany Road has been opened for residents and officers to use.  A resident said on Sunday: I hadnapost noticed anything until around noon when I opened our blinds and saw about four or five police cars and a van. At that time there was only one armed officer, but over the course of the next three or four hours they presence of armed police slowly increased to the point that now thereaposs between  and  armed officers here. There are at least six police cars and vans, four of five unmarked cars and four ambulances.  The first real movement was recently when the officers were gathering, one had a ladder, and they went around the corner.One posted on Facebook : Iaposm locked in my house, while another added police wouldnapost let him leave his house.Coventry City Council are arranging temporary accommodation for families stranded outside the cordon while a rest centre has been set up at Earlsdon Library. A council spokesperson said: We are supporting the police as they respond to an on-going incident on Earlsdon Avenue North. We can confirm that we have organised a rest centre for those who need it within Earlsdon Library and we will also arrange temporary accommodation for anyone that is unable to enter their homes because of the police cordon. news uk-news prince-harry-nickname-duchess-cambridge-"Kate Middleton is a matriarch in waiting says HoltByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Jan | commentsWhen it comes to families, the members might have a few sweet and sometimes downright baffling nicknames for their ious members. And even the Royal Family are no exception to this.We previously learned how Prince William called The Queen aposGaryapos when he was younger as he was unable to pronounce aposGrannyapos. While Prince Phillip is said to have called Her Majesty by several dferent pet names such as aposCabbageapos and aposSausageapos. Similarly, Prince Charles had dubbed Meghan Markle aposTungstenapos, because, just like the metal, he thought she was tough and unbending.And when it comes to Kate Middleton, it seems she also has a selection of weird and wonderful nicknames - although one, in particular, is much closer to her full name.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. According to OK! Magazine, the Duke of Sussex doesnapost call the Duchess of Cambridge aposKateapos, but instead refers to his sister-in-law as Cath.The duchess, , has been known to the world as Kate for years, but it turns out she actually only started using the nickname aposKateapos while at university, previously preferring to go by her full name, Catherine. Kate has previously admitted that she doesnapost mind which name people choose to call her.  During an interview with BBC Radio  presenter Scott Mills she said: I will answer to most things.As well as Catherine, Kate and Cath, the duchess is also frequently called aposbabeapos and aposdarlingapos by her husband, aposmummyapos by her children and while at school she was known as aposSqueakapos. The latter was derived from the name of a guinea pig.Kate and her younger sister Pippa both had pet guinea pigs, named Pip and Squeak, from which they later took nicknames, with Pippa becoming known as Pip and Kate taking on the other moniker.If that werenapost enough, her friends at Marlborough College are also said to have called her the aposPrincess-in-waitingapos for a while.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince HarryRoyal FamilyPrince William" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news queens--platinum-jubilee-anniversary-"The Queen’s Platinum Jubilee celebrations programme in fullBySophie CorcoranRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsBuckingham Palace has unveiled the full programme of events to mark the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee. Celebrations will include the -year-old monarch opening her private estates to the public and some of the worldaposs biggest stars performing outside Buckingham Palace. It is not clear which events Queen Elizabeth II will attend or take part in as she was ordered to rest by doctors in October last year following an overnight hospital stay for unspecied preliminary investigations. The bulk of the Jubilee duties are thought likely to be given to the rest of the Royal Family, including the Prince of Wales and Duchess of Cornwall. The Queen usually spends the anniversary of her accession privately at Sandringham.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  Official Jubilee celebrations will begin on Monday when Fortnum  Mason launches the Platinum Pudding Competition to find a dish to dedicate to the Queenaposs  years on the throne. Recipes will be judged by an expert  including Dame Mary Berry. It is hoped it will serve as a long-lasting reminder, alongside the Queenaposs Green Canopy initiative, which will continue to plant new trees to present to her at the end of the year. From May  to , more than  horses and , performers are expected to take part in a show on the grounds of Windsor Castle, which will take the audience through history from Elizabeth I to the present day.  More ceremonies are to take place later in the year, starting on Thursday, June , the first day of the special four-day bank holiday, when the Queenaposs Birthday Paradewill take place in Horse Guards Parade. On the same day, the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and UK Overseas Territories will come together to light a beacon at the same time as the principal beacon at Buckingham Palace. On Friday, June , a Service of Thanksgiving for the Queenaposs reign will be held at St Paulaposs Cathedral, before the star-studded Platinum Party At The Palace on Saturday, June .  Performers are yet to be named but it is being billed as bringing together some of the worldaposs biggest names in entertainment. People across the country will sit down together for the Big Jubilee Lunch on Sunday, June , the final day of the bank holiday break. Sandringham and Balmoral will also be open for residents and visitors to enjoy the celebrations across the long weekend.  Performers, dancers, musicians, military personnel, key workers and volunteers will tell the story of the Queenaposs reign in the Platinum Jubilee Pageant, which will see a River Of Hope - made up of  silk flags - make its way along the Mall. Schoolchildren across the country have been invited to create a picture of their hopes for the planet over the next  years, and some of their designs will be put onto the flags. From July, three displays marking the Queenaposs accession to the throne, the Coronation and Jubilees will be put on at the official royal residences.  Here is a list of all of the events taking place for the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee: January : Platinum Pudding competition The competition is inviting members of the public to create a dish to dedicate to the Queenaposs reign. May -: Platinum Jubilee Celebration More than  horses and , performers will take part in a -minute show taking the Windsor Castle audience through history right from Elizabeth I to the present day. Bank Holiday: June : Queenaposs Birthday ParadeThe colour will be trooped on Horse Guards Parade by the st Battalion, Irish Guards and over , officers and soldiers from the Household Division who will put on a display. Sandringham and Balmoral will also be open for residents and visitors to enjoy the celebrations across the Bank Holiday. Platinum Jubilee Beacons The UK will join the Channel Islands, Isle of Man and UK Overseas Territories to light a beacon to mark the Jubilee. The Principal Beacon will also be lit in a ceremony at Buckingham Palace. June : Service of Thanksgiving The Service of Thanksgiving for the Queenaposs reign will be held at St Paulaposs Cathedral. June : Platinum Party at the Palace Some of the worldaposs greatest entertainers are billed to perform at the concert at Buckingham Palace to celebrate the most signicant moments from the Queenaposs reign. June : Big Jubilee Lunch Street parties are being planned across the UK and neighbours are expected to join together for food and fun to celebrate the Platinum Jubilee. It will mark the end of the Bank Holiday. Platinum Jubilee Pageant Performers will come together in London to tell the story of the Queenaposs reign through a pageant that will include a River of Hope section made up of  silk flags that will make its way through The Mall, appearing like a moving river. July: The Royal Collection Trust Three displays marking the Queenaposs accession to the throne, the Coronation and Jubilees will be put on at Buckingham Palace, Windsor Castle and the Palace of Holyroodhouse. news uk-news secrets-kate-middletons-th-birthday-"Kate Middleton releases photographs to mark th birthdayByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Royal fans had been hoping the Duchess of Cambridge would release new official photos to mark her th birthday - and they were not disappointed.Three beautul portraits were shared for the occasion - each showing Kate in a dferent light.In two of the images, she wears flowing light dresses while in the third she dresses up in a vibrant ruby red gown - completing the look with loose curly hair and natural-looking make-up. The pictures were snapped during a secret photoshoot at Kew Gardens last November by famous fashion photographer Paolo Roversi, whose previous work has graced the pages of Vogue and Vanity Fair. And Mr Roversi has opened up on exactly how he came to work with Kate and how he also snapped some special photos that are likely to remain private... First meeting The first meeting between Kate and Mr Roversi came last November at Kensington Palace, where the photographer says they met for tea and biscuits.And during this meeting, he says he found Kate a little nervous about carrying out the shoot.He told Italian newspaper Corriere della Sera : “At first the Duchess was apprehensive. She is machine-gunned by photographers every day but is not used to posing.“Knowing my photos with models she was a little fearful of facing a real session, which required about four hours of work. But I reassured her that once we started it was going to be very easy. Dresses and jewellery Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.In the portraits, Kate wears three absolutely stunning dresses created by a designer who sheaposs worked with numerous times in the past - Sarah Burton for Alexander McQueen.Sarahaposs relationship with Kate goes back more than  years as she also created her iconic wedding gown. And it appears her trust in her is steadfast as itaposs been reported Kate allowed Sarah to pick the dresses for the shoot. For the official portrait , Kate wears a stunning light organza dress, which Mr Roversi says makes the duchess look like a classical ballerina.In terms of jewellery, Kate wears her eye-catching engagement ring and in two of the shots, opts for a pair of diamond earrings on loan from the Queen.While in the photo where she wears the red dress, she wears diamond and pearl drop earrings that once belonged to her late mother-in-law Princess Diana.Hair and make-up  When it came to Kateaposs hair and make-up, the photographer was keen for a less is more approach, with a no defined hair style and little make-up. He told the Italian publication: “I didnapost want her to look too Lady Duchess, too establishment, but as pure and contemporary as possible. Or even timeless.” On the shoot  While taking her picture, Mr Roversi said he was moved by Kateaposs warm and friendly welcome and enchanted by her shining eyes that reflected the loveliness of her soul and her smile showing the generosity of her heart. He added: It was a profound and rich experience for me, an unforgettable moment. I have met a wonderful person, a person who, with her positive energy, can bring hope to the whole world. The photographer also revealed that for some of the images he took, he persuaded Kate to dance and twirl across the floor - something sheaposs rarely done in public. He said: In the end I wanted to take some moving pictures, so with that wonderful wide skirt I made her dance in front of my lens, a sort of accelerated waltz mixed with a pinch of rock aposnapos roll. But unfortunately, he says these dancing images are likely to remain private and have not been released. Selecting the images After the shoot, the photographer was left with a set of around  pictures, which he whittled down to .He says he and Kate then worked together to choose the three final portraits. The Italian newspaper suggests that Prince William and their childrenaposs favourite shot is the one where she looks directly into the camera.The photos, part of the National Portrait Gallery’s Coming Home exhibition, will go on display in Berkshire, where Kate grew up, St Andrews, where she met Prince William, and Anglesey, their first marital home.And yesterday, Kate thanked her many well-wishers on Twitter, in a rare personal tweet. She said: Thank you for all of your very kind birthday wishes, and to Paolo and the National Portrait Gallery for these three special portraits. C. title: size 30 woman flew turkey
story: Size  woman flew to Turkey after psychic predicted shed die without drastic actionRebecca Wilkinson, , from Derbyshire weighed st lbs at her heaviest - but underwent a gastric sleeve operation in  that she said "changed her le"Rebecca Wilkinson flew to Turkey to have surgery that she says changed her le Image: Rebecca Wilkinson   SWNSByKatie Pearson:,  Jan | commentsA woman flew to Turkey to have her stomach removed before losing more than -and-a-half stone after a psychic predicted she would die without drastic action. Rebecca Wilkinson, , started putting on weight in her teens and saw her weight rocket after falling pregnant with her child at  - piling on nearly  stone in just under two years. She would often indulge in two takeaways a day followed by snacks like chocolate, crisps, and sweets - washed down with litres of Lucozade.At her biggest, Rebecca was defined as obese - weighing st lbs and was struggling to squeeze into a size -.After years of dieting the mum-of-one saw no changes until a trip to a psychic scared her into action. He revealed she had no futureshe carried on her unhealthy habits and told her to do whatever it takes or die. The bombshell kicked-started her weight loss journey and she booked a flight to Antalya, Turkey, to undergo a private gastric sleeve operation in September . A year after the operation to remove part of her stomach, she lost a staggering st lb - slimming down to st lb and a svelte size -. Rebecca, an apprentice plasterer, from Ilkeston, Derbyshire, said: “I was desperate after years of trying and failing to lose weight. “During a visit to my psychic, he scared me into action. He said he saw aposno leapos for me on the cards. “He also said: aposDo what it takes - go to the extreme or you will die.apos I knew I had to take drastic actions and surgery was the only way. “The weight has fallen off after having my stomach removed - it’s turned my le around.” Rebecca struggled with bullies during her teens and beyond - turning to food for comfort. She saw the weight start piling on, especially after she fell pregnant with her first child, Libby, . The mum would often tuck into a takeaway for lunch and dinner - followed by snacks. She said: “I went to an all-girls school, and I was bullied really badly. In school, they nicknamed me aposRebecca double-deckerapos because I was bigger than the others girls. I definitely ate to feel better. “I’d start the day with four pieces of buttered toast, andI was peckish at midmorning, I’d easily repeat this. “For lunch, I’d get a takeaway and dinner every single night was a takeaway as well.” As her weight spiralled out of control, Rebecca struggled with her mental health and suffered from anxiety and depression. She hoped for another baby with her partner of  years, Matt, , who owns a plastering company, but struggled to conceive for the next  years due to her weight. At her biggest, she weighed a whopping st lbs and struggled to fit into a size . She said: “For years I tried to ignore the mess I was in. I wouldn’t leave the house without my mum or fiancé by my side. “I was selective over where I went in case I didn’t fit in the seat or the toilet cubicle. I even had people shouting profanities at me from passing cars. Rebecca tried and failed to diet over the years and was left feeling ‘defeated’. She was ready to give up when a trip to visit a psychic in  changed everything. According to Rebecca, he couldn’t see a future for her in the cards and told her to ‘sort it now’ or she would die. “I was sceptical of the psychic at first, but he knew things no one  did,” she said. The way he knew about how I’d eat and ‘hibernate’ afterwards. “I left the reading in tears, but it was important I did. He said: aposI don’t see any le left for you.apos It was the wake-up call I needed to change.” After the reading, Rebecca looked into private surgery for a gastric sleeve in the UK, but it would cost upwards of £,. She found the operation abroad in Turkey costing a fraction of the price - £, - and flew over in September  with her mum, Jayne Nunn, , who also underwent the surgery. The operation involved removing three-quarters of the stomach and the remaining amount formed a apossleeveapos or tube that lead to the intestine. After the surgery, Rebecca flew back to the UK and had to survive on a diet of liquids, purees, and soft foods for a month before being able to eat solid food again. Rebecca continues: My mum came with me and was such a big support. It all went well but it was a lot to adjust to with my new diet. Now I can only eat small amounts every two hours - like a Babybel or a small bit of protein like a salmon fillet. For dinner, Iaposll usually have a very small portion of whatever Iaposve cooked for the family. I donapost feel hunger or miss food. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Over a year, Rebecca said the weight fell away and she lost a whopping st lb, slimming down to st lb. She now wears a size - and said sheaposs had a whole new lease of le. Her mum Jayne also lost a staggering  stone after the surgery. Rebecca said: The weight has fallen off me - itaposs been amazing. Mum did an incredible job as well. Weaposre hoping toto Turkey for another surgery to remove the excess skin. I gave up my work from home job and now Iaposm an apprentice plasterer. I enjoy super long walks, going out and socialising which I never imagined would be possible. Most importantly, Iaposm able to move around and live pain-free. Hopefully, the weight loss will help with my fertility and having another baby. Itaposs changed my le. news uk-news sore-throat-omicron-symptom-covid-"Omicron: The first eight symptoms to look out forByMalvika Padin:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Typical signs of coronavirus have changed over the course of the pandemic as the virus mutated and new iants have emerged.The original three symptoms that people were told to look out for were fever, a new and continuous cough and loss or change of taste or smell.However, there are now more than  reported symptoms of Covid, with signs of the Omicron iant showing up very dferently from what we’re used to.According to Professor Tim Spector, lead scientist behind the ZOE app Covid study, cold-like symptoms have been the predominant feature of Omicron. Here’s what you need to know about one of the earliest signs of the virus. Is a sore throat an Omicron symptom   Scientists have reported that those who tested positive with the Omicron iant present with a dry cough and a scratchy throat. This symptom has been one of the initial signs of infection reported by % of people who have been infected. Since sore throats can be linked with other conditions like allergies and cold, it can be dficult to tellyouaposre experiencing a Covid symptom. The dference between a sore throat and scratchy throat is that sore throats are painful especially while swallowing, but scratchy throats are more itchy and irritated. So itaposs best to keep tabs on how your throat feels.The scratchy throat also causes you to develop a hoarse voice, which has also been reported as an early sign of Omicron. What are the main symptoms of Omicron   Besides the scratchy throat, the other common symptoms of Omicron are a runny nose, headache, muscle pains, fatigue and sneezing.Some of the more unusual symptoms include skin rashes, lower back pain, night sweats and sleep paralysis, nausea and vomiting, diarrhoea and sore eyes. While most Omicron symptoms have been described as mild, Dr Angelique Coetzee, the South African doctor who first raised the alarm on the new iant, warned that certain signs like headaches and myalgia could be felt more intensely by unvaccinated people.When should I get a PCR test done The NHS recommends that you should get a PCR testyou have any of the following symptoms: high temperature, new continuous cough or loss of taste or sense of smell.If you have any of the common symptoms of Covid, self-isolate immediately and get tested, evenyouaposve been vaccinated. Under new rules, you donapost have get a PCR testyou are asymptomatic, evenyour lateral flow test is positive. This means your self-isolation period ends earlier as long as you test negative on the lateral flow test. title: tiny flat posh london area
story: Tiny flat in posh London area listed for £-a-month - with bed nearly touching sinkThe apartment, in affluent Kensington, in west London, works out at £ per week but is so small that the kitchen is just centimetres from the bedTenants can barely fit in front of the kitchen sink Image: Space Let ZooplaByLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA flat in one of the countryaposs most exclusive areas has gone on the market for £ per month - and it is so small the bed is almost touching the kitchen sink. The one-person bedsit boasts it is fully furnished with trendy wooden floors. It also brags how the Victorian pad is in a great location in West Kensington, west London. But because it is so small, there isnapost enough space for a bathroom and the shower and toiler are shared with other residents in the block. The listing, marketed via Zoopla, shows the bed up against one wall while the kitchenette is just centimetres away. A sink, microwave and camping-style cooking hob are all within touching distance in the skinny pad which has a limited amount of floor space.  Despite its tiny size, a wardrobe, chest of drawers, table and one chair are also chucked in for good measure. Tenants have to stay for at least six months and the rent works out at just £ per week. Commenting on the listing, one person said: Randomly browsing apartments on Zoopla for no reason and I came across this. London housing is such a joke. Another person said: Youaposd barely be able to walk in there.  The Space Let listing reads: A single bedsit situated within a large Victorian house in-between West Kensington and Baronaposs Court stations with lots of amenities in the area. Fully furnished, wooden floors fitted throughout, own kitchen. Compact studio room furnished with a single bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers, small table and chairs. Own kitchen with a counter-top cooker and oven, microwave, fridge freezer, fitted stainless steel sink unit and a range of wall and base units. Shared bathroom with a shower, WC and wash-hand basin. title: two bed house goes under
story: Two-bed house goes under hammer for £, - even though its full of rubbishThe pad was listed as an "exciting" fixer upper but its been left with gaping holes in the ceiling and rooms are littered with festering rubbish in Glasgow, ScotlandEvery surface is covered with junk and debris Image: National Property RightmoveByLucas CumiskeyLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA two-bedroom house full of festering piles of litter is expected to fetch an impressive £, at auction. The squalid pad, in trendy Glasgow, is covered with weeds with what appears to be mould on some walls and gaping holes in the ceiling. Heaps of clothes, trash and trinkets blot out the floor in what looks like a living room area. Every surface in the kitchen and bathroom is likewise covered in debris - and the sink and bath are brimming with soiled toiletries. Despite its challenges, it is listed as an exciting fixer upper that just needs some love.  In promotional photos on Rightmove, the front door is wide open and further horror lies within. One shocking snap shows collapsed wooden beams from the ceiling strewn across what appears to be a bed. A second bedroom still has posters on the wall, while the bed is unmade with no sheets on it. Commenting on the listing, Louise Diana quipped: Iaposd at least like a ceiling for £,. Auctioneer National Property states: The house requires a full refurbishment and, due to the condition, is currently uninhabitable, non mortgageable and therefore a cash buy only, sold as seen, and unsafe for viewings. The dilapidated property also comes with overgrown front, side and rear gardens. But the firm insists the property is a wonderful development opportunity in a highly sought after area for a canny buyer. It adds: Recent sales of similarly sized properties nearby in good condition have reached superb prices. The house requires a complete refurbishment and is priced competitively to sell hence cash buy only. The auctioneer also suggests a buyer could seek planning permission for a rear extension and to develop the loft. The online auction ends on January . news uk-news uk-weather-ferocious-winds-heavy-"UK Weather: Met Office forecast frost and fogByWilliam Walker:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsHeavy rain is set to lash the nation sparking a string of flood alerts as ferocious gusts blast the country from today. And in parts of Scotland as much as five inches of snow is predicted to fall, with Pitlochry in Perthshire predicted to see the largest build-up.Dreary January will continue today as more wet weather batters the country, with some areas predicted to see gale force winds and some snow to the north.Temperatures will plunge with forecasters predicting the mercury to drop below zero in parts of northern Scotland, with sub zero temperatures in other northern regions.  Flood alerts have also been issued for nine areas in Wales and southwest England, with those in affected areas advised to look at the Environment Agency site for the latest information.  BBC forecaster Chris Fawkes said of Mondayaposs forecast: “Here’s this area of slightly milder air pushing in off the Atlantic behind this warm front. It’s the warm front that will continue to bring some patches of drizzle just about anywhere - but especially across the west.“Meanwhile, for west Scotland, there’ll be some heavier rain here and some stronger winds through the course of the afternoon. “Temperatures will be at their highest across western areas, reaching  degrees in Belfast. Across eastern areas not quite so high but still -C is above average for this time of the year.  “Monday night into Tuesday, a cold front pushes southwards - the murky, damp weather will be restricted to southern areas of England and Wales for Tuesday. Sunny spells developing widely behind that with just a few showers in the north west of Scotland.”Longer range predictions from the Met Office say that January will see aposunsettledapos conditions with more colder temperatures and some snow fall particularly in the north.UK Weather Forecast Today: A few foggy or frosty spots in the east at first. Early brightness in the southeast, where staying largely dry. Elsewhere cloudy with patchy rain, drizzle and hill fog. Milder away from the southeast, very mild in far west. Tonight: Rain, drizzle and low cloud continuing across many southern areas where mild. Clearer weather spreads to most northern areas but with strong winds and showers in west and north Scotland. Tuesday: Sunny intervals and showers across northern Scotland, where remaining windy. Some rain at first in the south but sunnier skies in central UK should follow to most places eventually. Outlook for Wednesday to Friday: Settled across many areas with sunny spells, overnight frost and morning fog patches, stubborn to clear in places. Milder and windier over northern Scotland, any rain mainly over western hills. title: woman 57 who couldnt walk
story: Woman, , who couldnt walk  yards found dead . miles from her homeKaren Jackson, , from Stockport, Greater Manchester, had bronchitis and her family remain baffled as to how she made her way to the river where she drownedKaren Jackson had bronchitis and her family remain baffled as to how she made her way to the river Image: MEN MediaByNick Jackson:,  Jan | comments A woman who could barely walk  yards without getting out of breath was found dead two-and-a-half miles from her home, an inquest heard.Karen Jacksonaposs body was discovered in the River Goyt, in Stockport, with a coroner concluding she died as a result of an accidental drowning. But her loved ones are baffled as to how she reached the water due to her bronchitis.CCTV footage showed a figure believed to be the -year-old walking alone towards a ginnel leading to the river shortly after midnight on the day of her death, reports the Manchester Evening News.The inquest into her death at Stockport Coroneraposs Court heard Karen, of Windle Court, Offerton, was found in the river near an access point off New Bridge Lane. She was found under the St Maryaposs Way bridge by a dog walker at .am on May , . Her coat, training shoes, phone, umbrella and a bag containing her personal items were found neatly placed nearby. Police coroneraposs officer PC David Wood told coroner Alison Mutch that investigating officers did not believe there were any suspicious circumstances surrounding her death with no aposthird party involvementapos.  Friend Nicki Connor attended the hearing and was allowed by Ms Mutch to question PC Wood. She said there were aposcertain questionsapos as to how Karen got to the location where she died from her home when aposshe could barely walkapos which aposremain unansweredapos. PC Wood said the concerns were passed on to the senior investigating officer, but were not deemed to be of signicance. The hearing was told that Karen suffered from bipolar affective disorder and had been under the care of Stockportaposs Community Mental Health Team until  before transitioning to a new PPSin Stockport. The service was set up to help people remain in the community and Karen was one of its first users. PPS pathway recovery worker Barry Tyldsley was helping Karen and had regular contact with her until her death. When lockdown came in March  she found it dficult because she was advised to shield as a result of her breathing dficulties and her weight, he said. She was part of that vulnerable group. She was very conscious of her condition and adhered to all the restrictions. But her anxieties were raised and she absolutely isolated herself. I increased my support, helped with her shopping and collecting medication and had regular telephone contact as a way of managing that anxiety. He said in  she was still feeling apospretty isolatedapos and was reluctant to meet up with people. Mr Tyldsley said the day before Karen died he emailed the Community Mental Health Team to ask for a clinical review and assessment. But because she had never mentioned taking her own le and had re-started taking medication for psychotic episodes, her case was not deemed urgent. Ms Mutch concluded there was no third-party involvement or suspicious circumstances surrounding Karenaposs death. She said that the cause of death was drowning and that because there was no evidence that Karen had taken her own le, the death was aposaccidentalapos. Speaking after the inquest, her two friends Nicki and Susan Harrison told how Karen had previously worked as a doctoraposs receptionist and in retail. She had also taught English as a foreign language. title: woman itchy scaly patches skin
story: Woman with itchy, scaly skin condition learned to love herself after scary flare upsRosie McKenzie first major psoriasis flare up back in , when she was just  years oldand still has the condition three years later which leaves her with red, flay and itchy skinRosie McKenzie Image: MERCURY PRESSByBeth UreGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA woman with itchy scaly patches on her skin praises social media for teaching her how to love herself.Rosie McKenzie had her first major psoriasis flare up back in , when she was just  years old.Now, three years later, Rosie, works as a HR apprentice, still suffers from the condition, which often leaves her face red, itchy and flakey.The once insecure teenager credits Instagram, for helping her accept her skin condition.Rosie, , said: Iaposve had flare ups for about three years now, and this year I just decided I wasnapost going to hide away anymore. It has been hard, because this flare up has affected my face mainly, and Iaposve had to go into work, but everyone has been really good about it. My family and friends have all encouraged me to post about my experience on social media, which has really helped. Posting about it has made me much happier, and showed me itaposs not just me who struggles with this. Of course social media doesnapost always help people with body confidence and things like that, but itaposs really helped me. Rosie, who lives in Cambridge. said that writing down her journey and experience in Instagram posts was very therapeutic. She also spoke about the journey she has been on to get to this point. She said: The first flare up I had, it was literally like I went to bed one night and when I woke up and my skin had completely changed. It was actually quite scary, because it all comes out at once, so I suddenly had all these like red dots on my skin. I was only , so it was a big shock, and it was all so quick. Doctors attributed Rosieaposs sudden flare up to a throat infection she had at the time.  She said: Everything happens for a reason, but this has made me truly believe it. Because the first flare up was such a shock, I was trying to hide, I never wanted to go out, so I really struggled. I posted a picture when Iaposd had the first flare up, and someone commented askingI had chicken pox. So then of course I deleted it immediately, it was really hard. Then, the following year we were in lockdown, so it was easier to hide it then, because I couldnapost go out anyway. Usually the flare ups occur during the summer, but this year, Rosie has suffered with psoriasis in the winter too. But she refuses to let it bring her down and is no longer ashamed of her skin. She said:Previously, Iaposve always laid out in the sun and itaposs really helped. Obviously at the moment that isnapost really an option, so there was nothing  for it but to embrace my skin. news uk-news woman-left-giant-sausage-lips-"Beauty lover left with sausage lips following allergic reactionByNia Price:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A woman claims she was left with giant sausage lips that swelled  times their normal size after suffering a horror allergic reaction.Daniella Bolton went to get her lip filler dissolved last month as they had been in for a while and following the procedure she was told by the beautician that her swelling would soon subside. However, after she left they started getting bigger by the minute. By the time she arrived home her lips had completely ballooned, prompting the panicked -year-old to dash to the doctors, where she was given steroid tablets that quickly reduced the swelling. Horrying photos and footage captured by Daniella show her massive lips and puffy face - which she endured for around four hours before the medication eventually helped them to reduce in size.  After the aposawfulapos ordeal, the sales administrator is keen to raise awareness of the severe reactions that can happen following the procedure - evenyou get a patch test beforehand like she did. Daniella, of Edinburgh, Scotland, said: My reaction was awful. They looked like sausage lips. I donapost knowIaposm exaggerating but I would genuinely say they were about  times the normal size. It was so scary. I was in a lot of shock because Iaposve never seen my lips that big before. I was just a bit stressed about how they looked because I wasnapost sureit was normal orit was going to go away. I was in a panic thinking aposwhen are they going to go down apos Daniella said she originally booked her appointment to get half a ml of filler but decided to get them dissolved and start afresh to prevent it from migrating. She claims she had her patch test around - minutes before having the procedure that injected hyaluronidase, an enzyme that dissolves filler, into her lips. Daniella said: I got a little patch test in my arm just to seeit would be fine. My skin did go a little bit red but I do have really sensitive skin anyway so I didnapost think anything of it. I got the injections in my lips. They got big quite quickly but apparently when you get your lips dissolved theyaposre meant to go quite big anyway. Although Iaposm not sure theyaposre meant to go as big as what mine went. After I left the girl said to me that within an hour it should go down. After Iaposd left the place they started getting a little bit bigger every minute and I was like aposmy God, what has gone on aposBy the time Iaposd driven back to Edinburgh from Glasgow my lips were still the same. I sent her a message on Instagram and she phoned me straight away askingI was feeling ok andI started to struggle to breathe to go to AE because obviously thataposs when something would be severely wrong.  My lips were really big and I was starting to feel a little bit unwell as well. I was getting quite hot and I explained that to the doctors. The -year-old was given eight steroid tablets which reduced the swelling within  minutes and also made her feel a lot better. Daniella said: That evening I was meant to be having a work night but then I couldnapost go because of how I had reacted so I had to cancel my Friday night plans which was a bit gutting, but at least I was fine thataposs the main thing. Iaposve only ever seen it happen once before and never really heard of it. Itaposs not really something thataposs spoken about and obviously it can be quite dangerous as well. It could have been really severe and I was quite lucky that my throat didnapost close up or anything because I know that can happen after reading up on it. Itaposs just to make people aware that these reactions can happen and just because you get a patch test doesnapost mean that itaposs  percent going to be fine. title: woman opens packet walkers crisps
story: Woman opens packet of Walkers crisps from Sainsburys to find it completely emptyYarna Davies, who lives in Cathays, Wales, purchased a multipack of cheese and onion Walkers from her local Sainsburys only to find one of the packets had not a single crisp insideYarna Davies, from Cathays in Wales, said there was not even a crumb in the packet Image: Jonathon HillByJonathon HillRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A woman opened a Walkers multipack to find one of the packets had not even a crumb of the tasty snack inside. Yarna Davies, from Cathays in Wales, visited her local Sainsbury’s store on Monday, January , after having a hankering for a multi-pack of cheese and onion Walkers.When she ed home she scoffed one packet and was so hungry she immediately ed into another.But to her horror the second packet didnapost have even a crumb” of the popular snack inside, she told WalesOnline.“I bought them in Sainsbury’s down the road and opened the first packet about three days ago,” the barber and hairdresser said.  “My friend was here and I finished the first packet. I thought ‘ooh, I’m still hungry - I’ll have another one’. I shook the pack, and though ‘ooh, that’s funny’. And I said to my friend ‘have a look at this’. Obviously no noise or anything when I shook the packet. “My friend said ‘oh my god that’s amazing - you need to do something about that’. I thought ‘don’t be silly’. But my friend said ‘honestly now, it’s a once in a letime thing’. So I thought ‘yeah I’ll share it’.”  Yarna said Walkers saw her post and she was very pleased with their response. “They saw it and said they’d reimburse me with vouchers and they apologised,” Yarna explained. “They said there was a problem with the machines. She said they’d had a problem with delivery drivers and something must have gone wrong with the production line. “I can’t lie I was about annoyed when I realised [there were no crisps in the packet], but now I just think it was one of those things.  “It’s really quite fun to leave it unopened and have it there. I think I’ll put it in a drawer and keep it. Like I say, it’s a once in a letime thing and this is never going to happen to me again.” “It’s really quite fun to leave it unopened and have it there. I think I’ll put it in a drawer and keep it. Like I say, it’s a once in a letime thing and this is never going to happen to me again.” Walkers was contacted for comment. news weird-news man-mortied-after-buying--"Man buys £ coat to be mistaken for Primark employeeByZahna EklundAudience writerBen Thompson:,  Jan | commentsFor those of us who love bagging a bargain when we go clothes shopping, Primark is usually at the top of the list of places to visit. So when we decide to splash the cash on a designer item, we might want to avoid comparisons to the fast fashion retailer. But thataposs what happened to Connor Cundale, who spent £ on a stylish North Face coat only to be told its black and blue colour scheme made him look like he worked at his local Primark. The -year-old advertising student poked fun at his predicament in a series of videos on TikTok, but was ultimately left so embarrassed by his shopping blunder that he ed the coat three weeks after he bought it. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In one video, Connor could be seen wearing his coat on Clton Suspension Bridge in Bristol, alongside a caption which read: You think you can hurt me  I spent £ on a coat just to look like a Primark employee. The student, from Buckhurst Hill, Essex, even wore the coat into his local Primark store - and was askedhe worked there. He said: On the day I bought it, I went out with my friends that evening. One of them made a comment like aposoh, heaposs wearing a Primark coat.apos I didnapost think anything of it, but that evening, it clicked in my head that I was a walking Primark advertisement. The colours were spot on.  I was in Primark one day, and this lady tapped me on the shoulder. She asked aposdo you work here apos, I just turned around and laughed. I said, aposNo, Iaposm just repping the colours.apos After that, I noticed loads of people staring at me. I donapost knowI was being paranoid, but I was wondering whether people were going to come up to me to ask for help. Connor insisted that while thereaposs nothing wrong with working in Primark, he didnapost want his everyday coat to look like a brandaposs unorm - so he decided toit. He added: I had someone I didnapost know at university make a comment to me, saying I looked like I worked in Primark.  It became well known in student halls that I was the guy with the North Face Primark employee coat. I was embarrassed. I felt like such a laughing stock for spending that much money on something now being related to a Primark employee. Nothing is wrong with working in Primark of course, but you just wouldnapost want your coat looking like a brandaposs unorm. I actually ended up ing the coat in the end. I had it for three weeks overall.  The student has instead decided to switch up his colour palette and has swapped the black and blue coat for a balsam green one. He explained: I didnapost like the idea of having spent so much money on it and then people making a joke out of it. It was a nice coat, it was a nice colour, it was just the connection. I only recently got into design stuff. North Face is a really good brand with high quality stuff, so I made an investment into it. I got a replacement coat in a balsam green colour. I made sure there were no resemblances to any supermarkets or any other big brands. I have the coat I want now, and Iaposm really happy with it. Connoraposs self-deprecating TikTok video went viral, with Primark employees among the commenters poking fun at his fashion disaster. One person wrote: Iaposm crying, I do work at Primark and you genuinely look like you could be my co-worker. While another said: Bro, you spent £ on a coat … the jokeaposs on you. And a third added: Employee of the month boyo, now get behind them tills. What do you think  Let us know in the comments below. title: mum 10 shares exhausting evening
story: Mum-of- shares exhausting evening routine - but people are baffled by one jobAlicia Dougherty has gone viral on TikTok after she shared a video of what she gets up to after her  kids go to bed to make sure that shes prepared for the next dayAlicia spends hours once the kids have gone to bed getting organised Image: @doughertydozen TikTokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA mum who shared her y evening routine online has left people stunned as she was up until midnight prepping her kidsapos lunches, bags and toothbrushes for the next day.American mum-of-ten Alicia Dougherty regularly shares videos on her TikTok account @doughertydozen, where sheaposs gained . million fans.But in a recent video, that has been viewed almost  million times, she showed her followers her evening routine after my kids go to bed, and people were exhausted just watching. Various clips show the mum tidying the house, making lunches and packing bags, all at an impressive speed. I unpack all of their lunchboxes and put their ice packs bag in the freezer, wash the dishes, clean up the mess they left all over my bathroom from showers, hang up their towels, she said.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She then gets puts toothpaste on all  of her kidsapos toothbrushes and sets out their school clothes out ready for a busy morning. Alicia continued: I pack their snacks for school and I put them in their backpacks with water for the next day. Then I go through all their coats and take out their wet mittens and make sure they have a nice dry pair and I make sure they have an extra face mask in their backpack.  After their bags are packed, she starts with the housework. She said: Then I vacuum, make sure all the kids’ iPads are plugged in for the next day. Only once all of that is done can she finally sit down at midnight. Since being posted, the video has been liked more than . million times and has received more than , comments from people who were stunned by the exhausting routine. One person said: You’re truly amazing. They canapost put toothpaste on their own toothbrushes  Or clean up after themselves  said another. A third commented: Literally like two-thirds of those kids are old enough to do all that. Someone  asked: Why arenapost the kids helping  Oh momma. Those  kids are someoneaposs future husband or we. Please donapost do this for them, added another viewer.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: mum dropped amazing nine stone
story: Mum dropped an amazing nine stone after she went plant-based for VeganuaryMay Polirer, , of Portslade, East Sussex, decided to try out Veganuary two years ago, and since then has lost nine stone and slimmed down from a size  to a size May wants to encourage others to reach their goals Image: Triangle NewsByRosaleen FentonAudience WriterEmily Hall:,  Jan | comments Itaposs hard to believe now, but just two years ago May Polirer was a size  and desperate to change her diet - but struggling to find something that worked.Tesco worker May found herself huffing and puffing when just walking upstairs and admitted that she didnapost like going out with mates as she felt self-conscious.Many people who have lost weight attribute their success to joining a gym or ditching carbs. In Mayaposs case, however, her weight-loss journey occurred after she started Veganuary - which is ongoing at the moment.The -year-old decided to try out the lestyle for a month after a chat with a colleague - and has kept it up ever since.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here May dropped an amazing nine stone and can now fit into size eight outfits and says she finds herself aposzooming aboutapos She says she loved treating herself to takeaway pepperoni pizzas and fried chicken but decided to ditch meat and dairy on New Yearaposs Eve two years ago. She has stuck to the way of eating ever since and has dropped down to just over nine stone. Chuffed May says she has gone from huffing and puffing when just walking up stairs to “zooming around all day” in her job as a horticulture expert for Tesco.  May, of Portslade, East Sussex, said: “I was so fat that I didn’t really like going out with friends and the more I stayed in the fatter I got. It was a catch  situation. “I would buy frozen pepperoni pizzas and I’d stuff them down with chocolate and a bottle of Coke. I never ate one biscuit, it was always the entire pack. “And I loved takeaways - pepperoni pizzas with two sides and a fizzy drink. I loved pepperami, bacon and salami.” She had chatted to her GP about her weight in the past but wasn’t deemed obese enough to qualy for a gastric band.Instead, she was sent on an NHS healthy eating course but actually put on weight because she had to go across town to attend - and she’d end up grabbing food on the way.Another weakness was ice cream milkshakes that she would whip up at home which contained more than , calories a time. “I just felt sick, but I had to eat it because it was there. I’d pour washing up liquid over things so I couldn’t eat them and would have to throw them away,” she added. May has worked in her local Tesco since  and got chatting to her colleague and friend Charlotte Taylor about her vegan lestyle two years ago. That January she decided to make a change and went completely plant-based, ditching all meat and dairy.Veganuary is a month-long crowdfunded challenge that aims to introduce people to a non-animal way of eating - helping animals and the environment by slashing CO.May also cut out bread, pasta, and sugar and the weight began to fall off. She now weighs between nine and nine-and-a-half stone and can fit into size eight clothing. And she says she is grateful to the month-long vegan event for turning her le around, with son Nathan, , super proud of her. She added: “Plant-based for me has been le-changing. I’m more confident and I really think I will stick with it forever. “I would tell people to do it. I feel so much more educated. If they can make Galaxy chocolate taste exactly the same without dairy, why do you need milk in it ” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSGastric bandsDietWeight loss success storiesVegan" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman slammed stopping boyfriend being
story: Woman slammed for stopping boyfriend from being his childhood friends best manA woman took to Reddit to ask users whether she was unreasonable for not telling her boyfriend that she doesnt want him to be a part of his best pals wedding over a feud with the groom-to-bes fiancéeHis pal had asked him to be his best man Image: Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has been slammed online after she told her boyfriend that he couldnapost be his close friendaposs best man at his wedding.Posting on Reddit, the -year-old shared the exciting news that she and her boyfriend of two years are expecting a baby.But conflict arose when her boyfriend was asked to be his childhood friendaposs best man at his wedding. She explained that the two couples used to be really close until the soon-to-beaposs groomaposs fiancée betrayed her and went behind her back.Despite not being included in the wedding party, her boyfriend offered to bring her along, in case issues arose with her pregnancy — but she refused, and told him she doesnapost want him to go along either. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. I told him that I wasnapost going to sit through and watch someone who betrayed me celebrate love, she wrote. I lost it and told him thatIaposm not going to the wedding, then he shouldnapost be his best man and should prioritize me and the baby. Itaposd be awkward with his fiancéI went, and his best friend can find someone  to be his best man. I told some of my friends this, and they said though the pregnancy is important for him to be attentive to, I should move on from the drama and let him be there for his best friendaposs big day. She concluded her post by asking whether she was in the wrong, and many users were quick to point the blame at her. One person said: [Youaposre the a**hole]. You can sit at home pregnant and p***y, but you have no right to tell your boyfriend he canapost be the best man in his best friendaposs wedding. aposI’m not going to sit and watch someone who betrayed me celebrate loveapos more than sealed it for me, said another. [Original poster] is simply being overly dramatic and holding a grudge. Now she’s punishing her boyfriend because he isn’t holding the same grudge on her behalf. Someone gossiped about her so they don’t deserve to be loved  Give me a break. A third added: Couldn’t have said it better myself. What a selfish person. What do you think  Whoaposs in the wrong here  Let us know in the comments.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: bride rushes out covid nightclub
story: Bride-to-be rushes out to get Covid in nightclub to not ruin wedding in  weeks timeA bride-to-be posted a video of herself on TikTok darting around a club in Melbourne, hugging revellers and sharing drinks, in an "unwise" bid to try catch Covid before her big day in six weeksAn unidentied TikToker posted a video of herself carrying out her plan of getting infected with Covid to avoid her wedding day being ruined in six weeks Image: maddysmart TikTokByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A bride-to-be hugged partygoers and shared drinks in a club as part of her mission to catch Covid- now so it doesnapost ruin her wedding day in six weeks.The woman was seen flouting the social distancing concept as she darted around a swanky nightclub in Melbourne, Australia months before she ties the knot in February.Covid cases in Australia are reaching record heights as Omicron clubs together with other strains and lts infections to almost , every day.In the clip posted on video-sharing app TikTok, the soon-to-be we hugs several men and other women boogying on the dancefloor - hoping to catch Covid so it doesnapost impede on her nuptials. She captioned the clip, which was titled Catch Covid not feelings, saying: POV your wedding is in six weeks and you still havenapost had Covid. Experts across the globe have warned of the dangers of going out of your way to catch the disease - which has killed millions worldwide. At the start of December, one catch-Covid party in Norway ended with a record  to  people infected with the then-unresearched Omicron strain. The woman may not get another chance to risk her health after the state of Victoria rolled out temporary bans on dancing indoors to slow Omicronaposs spread. Other bachelorettes hoping to save their big day, and potentially thousands of pounds, commented on the video. One woman wrote: Feb  bride and I feel this on so many levels. Another said: We need to do this before your engagement just in case.Speaking to the Daily Mail, an infectious disease expert warned the public against trying to catch Covid deliberately.Dr Catherine Bennett urged people to avoid being infected for as long as you possibly can. The epidemiologist added that people actively trying to get infected when they could ride through the current surge isnapost wise. Weaposre hearing lots of people say aposit might be mildapos but itaposs actually really terrible, soyou can avoid it, do, she added. She advised people get a booster shot as a more sensible way of swerving the more severe aspects of the virus. story: COMPASSIONATE and dedicated, Dr Margaret Kerr’s work in Glasgow saved the lives of hundreds of premature babies. The consultant paediatrician at what was then the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill was a leading light in neo-natal medicine. She once said in an interview with the Evening Times: “I love babies – we are no longer just saving le but producing healthy future citizens. That gives us all pride and pleasure.”

story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists.
